citeinfo.title: MUSEUMS_IGS_IN: Museums in Indiana (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
citeinfo.othercit: The addresses, URLs, and information regarding type of facility were obtained from various Web pages, including the following: Museum and Historic Site Directory (http://www.collectics.com/museums_indiana.html), MuseumLink's Museum of Museums (http://www.museumlink.com/indiana.htm), Step into Places (http://www.stepintoplaces.com/resource%20guide/Quick/Guide_IN.htm), and Historical Museum Guide for Indiana (http://www.censusfinder.com/indiana-historical-museums.htm#Indiana%20Museums). Personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey used ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator" and used the "Geocoding" tool to perform address-matching, using street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, v. 17.0.

descript.abstract: MUSEUMS_IGS_IN is a point shapefile showing the locations of 118 museums in Indiana. Using street addresses obtained from Web pages, a shapefile was created using the "Geocoding" tool in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 and street information licensed from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, v. 17.0.
descript.purpose: This data set was compiled to create a GIS layer showing locations of museums in Indiana.
descript.supplinf: Museum and Historic Site Directory (http://www.collectics.com/museums_indiana.html), MuseumLink's Museum of Museums (http://www.museumlink.com/indiana.htm), Step into Places (http://www.stepintoplaces.com/resource%20guide/Quick/Guide_IN.htm), and Historical Museum Guide for Indiana (http://www.censusfinder.com/indiana-historical-museums.htm#Indiana%20Museums)

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcGIS version 9.2 shapefile format, approximately 152 Kb

attracc.attraccr: Street addresses for museums were obtained from various Web sites and are assumed to be accurate. Geocoding initially produced match scores of more than 80 percent for about 90 percent of museums. Locations of other museums were plotted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap version 9.2, together with information obtained from Google searches, MapQuest (http://www.mapquest.com/maps/), and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project.

dataqual.logic: No checks for logical consistency were made.
dataqual.complete: Additional museums may exist that are not included. In particular, not all county-based, historical society museums are included.

horizpa.horizpar: For match scores greater than 80 percent, plotted locations are generally within several hundred feet of actual locations.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the production of this shapefile.

citeinfo.title: Addresses and Web-site URLs obtained from directories downloaded from the Web, including: Museum and Historic Site Directory (http://www.collectics.com/museums_indiana.html), MuseumLink's Museum of Museums (http://www.museumlink.com/indiana.htm), Step into Places (http://www.stepintoplaces.com/resource%20guide/Quick/Guide_IN.htm), and Historical Museum Guide for Indiana (http://www.censusfinder.com/indiana-historical-museums.htm#Indiana%20Museums).
Dynamap 2000
citeinfo.othercit: Indiana Roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, v. 17.0, licensed to the Indiana Geological Survey

srcinfo.srccitea: Indiana Roads from Tele Atlas, Dynamap 2000, v. 17.0
srcinfo.srccontr: Indiana streets and roads suitable for geocoding

procstep.procdesc: The addresses for each museum were obtained by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey (IGS) from various directories on the Web. The street addresses, together with Web-site URLs for each facility, were compiled into a spreadsheet. The spreadsheet was saved as a comma-delimited text file.

IGS personnel used street information licensed from Tele Atlas in ESRI ArcMap 9.2 to build an "Address Locator." Using the "Geocoding" tool to perform address-matching, the comma-delimited text file named "Museums_in_csv.txt" was address-matched. Ninety-two (92) museums were matched to known addresses. Twenty-six (26) locations were manually plotted using the "Editor" tool in ESRI ArcMap, as well as information obtained through Google searches, locations plotted by MapQuest, and inspection of aerial photographs of the 2005 Indiana Orthophotography Project. The output was saved as MUSEUMS_IGS_IN.SHP. In the attribute table of this shapefile, the field named "ARC_Street" was renamed as "GeoAddress," and the field named "Arc_Zone" was renamed as "GeoZip." The fields named "Side" and "Zip" were deleted.

This metadata file was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v. 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v. 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (U.S. Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

edom.edomvd: Originally either an "unmatched" address in batch geocoding or a matched address with a low (less than 80) match score. Location was subsequently plotted or revised by personnel of the IGS.
In batch geocoding, the address was automatically matched with a match score of more than 80

attr.attrdef: In geocoding, a value is assigned to all potential candidates for an address match. The match score is based on how well the location found in the reference data matches with the address data being searched.
Street address obtained from the Web.
Address using for geocoding, as obtained from the Web or through Google searches conducted by personnel of the Indiana Geological Survey.
City in which museum is located
Type of museum. Types include Art, Children, General, Historical Society, History, House Museum, Military, Music, Science, Sport, and Transportation.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It is not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone other than the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
